summary: This is a letter from defense attorney Laura Menninger to Judge Nathan regarding the case US v. Maxwell, responding to the government's submission on Rule 17 subpoena items 9-11. The letter includes attachments and requests filing under seal due to a confidential government document.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell submitting a letter response to the court regarding Rule 17 subpoena matters.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the US v. Maxwell case, addressed in the correspondence.

persons.name: Bobbi Stemheim
persons.context: Appears to be copied on the email correspondence regarding the court filing.

persons.name: Jeff Pa liuca
persons.context: Appears to be copied on the email correspondence regarding the court filing (name appears garbled in text).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'Ms. Maxwell', the defendant in the case US v. Maxwell.

connections.description: Menninger is submitting a legal response on behalf of her client Maxwell in the criminal case.
Menninger is communicating with Judge Nathan regarding court procedures and filings.

events.title: Defense Response to Government Subpoena Submission
events.description: Laura Menninger files a letter response on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell regarding the government's submission on Rule 17 subpoena items 9-11.

keyFacts: The document is a legal filing in the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) from May 2021.
Defense attorney Laura Menninger is responding to the government's submission regarding Rule 17 subpoena items 9-11.
The filing includes a document marked 'Confidential' by the government, requiring it to be filed under seal.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal proceedings and evidentiary disputes in the Maxwell case.
